prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, a curved side, and a straight side. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and translation vector `[0.0, 0.075, 0.0]`. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a line from point `[0.0, 0.0]` to point `[0.75, 0.0]`. 4. Draw a line from point `[0.75, 0.0]` to point `[0.75, 0.45]`. 5. Draw a line from point `[0.75, 0.45]` to point `[0.0, 0.45]`. 6. Draw a line from point `[0.0, 0.45]` to point `[0.0, 0.0]`. 7. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 8. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 9. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.075 units in the direction of the positive Z-axis to create the 3D model. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and translation vector `[0.0696, 0.0, 0.1694]`. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a circle with a center at point `[0.0906, 0.0906]` and a radius of 0.0906. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1811. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.15 units in the direction opposite to the normal vector to create a cylindrical cut. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The rectangular prism has a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.075 units, and a height of 0.75 units. The cylindrical hole has a length of 0.1811 units, a width of 0.15 units, and a height of 0.1811 units.</description>
